-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Haskell interface to the Fedora Packages webapp API.
--   
--   Provides access to the (<a>Fedora Packages</a>) API.
@package fedora-packages
@version 0.0.3


-- | Used for configuring how to connect to the Fedora Packages API.
module Fedora.Packages.Config
data PackagesConfig
PackagesConfig :: URL -> PackagesConfig

-- | The base URL (with protocol) of Fedora Packages.
_baseurl :: PackagesConfig -> URL

-- | The default configuration, which points to the production instance of
--   Fedora Packages.
defaultConfig :: PackagesConfig

-- | The staging configuration, which points to the staging instance of
--   Fedora Packages.
stagingConfig :: PackagesConfig
instance Eq PackagesConfig
instance Show PackagesConfig


-- | Functions and datatypes for directly calling out to the API and
--   handling queries to and responses from it.
module Fedora.Packages.API
data StandardResults a
StandardResults :: [a] -> Int -> Int -> Int -> Int -> StandardResults a
_srRows :: StandardResults a -> [a]
_srRowsPerPage :: StandardResults a -> Int
_srStartRow :: StandardResults a -> Int
_srTotalRows :: StandardResults a -> Int
_srVisibleRows :: StandardResults a -> Int
data Query a
Query :: a -> Int -> Int -> Query a
_qSearch :: Query a -> a
_qRowsPerPage :: Query a -> Int
_qStartRow :: Query a -> Int

-- | Perform a GET request to the API.
apiGet :: FromJSON a => ByteString -> PackagesConfig -> IO a

-- | Given something searchable, return a <a>Query</a> with default values
--   for JSON fields <a>rows_per_page</a> and <a>start_row</a>.
--   
--   The default values (respectively) are 20 and 0.
defaultQueryPagination :: a -> Query a
instance Eq a => Eq (StandardResults a)
instance Show a => Show (StandardResults a)
instance Eq a => Eq (Query a)
instance Show a => Show (Query a)
instance ToJSON a => ToJSON (Query a)
instance FromJSON a => FromJSON (StandardResults a)


-- | Provides functions and datatypes for accessing information about
--   bugzilla bugs filed for Fedora packages.
module Fedora.Packages.Bugs
data Bug
Bug :: Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Bug
_bugClass :: Bug -> Text
_bugDescription :: Bug -> Text
_bugId :: Bug -> Int
_bugLastModified :: Bug -> Text
_bugRelease :: Bug -> Text
_bugStatus :: Bug -> Text
data BugsFilter
BugsFilter :: Text -> Version -> BugsFilter
_bPackage :: BugsFilter -> Text
_bVersion :: BugsFilter -> Version
data Version
AllVersions :: Version
Rawhide :: Version
F20 :: Version
F19 :: Version
F18 :: Version
EL7 :: Version
EL6 :: Version
EL5 :: Version

-- | Query to find bugs for a given package.
bugs :: PackagesConfig -> Query BugsFilter -> IO (StandardResults Bug)
instance Eq Version
instance Eq BugsFilter
instance Show BugsFilter
instance Eq Bug
instance Show Bug
instance FromJSON Bug
instance ToJSON BugsFilter
instance Show Version


-- | Provides functions and datatypes for accessing information about
--   Fedora package builds.
module Fedora.Packages.Builds
data Build
Build :: Int -> Text -> CompletionTimeDisplay -> Double -> Int -> Text -> Double -> Maybe Double -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Int -> Text -> Build
_buildId :: Build -> Int
_completionTime :: Build -> Text
_completionTimeDisplay :: Build -> CompletionTimeDisplay
_completionTs :: Build -> Double
_creationEventId :: Build -> Int
_creationTime :: Build -> Text
_creationTs :: Build -> Double
_epoch :: Build -> Maybe Double
_name' :: Build -> Text
_nvr :: Build -> Text
_ownerId :: Build -> Int
_ownerName :: Build -> Text
_packageId :: Build -> Int
_packageName :: Build -> Text
_packageRelease :: Build -> Text
_state :: Build -> Int
_stateStr :: Build -> Text
_taskId :: Build -> Int
_version :: Build -> Text
_volumeId :: Build -> Int
_volumeName :: Build -> Text
data BuildsFilter
BuildsFilter :: Text -> BuildState -> BuildsFilter
_bfPackage :: BuildsFilter -> Text
_bfState :: BuildsFilter -> BuildState
data BuildState
All :: BuildState
Building :: BuildState
Success :: BuildState
Failed :: BuildState
Cancelled :: BuildState
Deleted :: BuildState
data CompletionTimeDisplay
CompletionTimeDisplay :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CompletionTimeDisplay
_elapsed :: CompletionTimeDisplay -> Text
_time :: CompletionTimeDisplay -> Text
_when :: CompletionTimeDisplay -> Text

-- | Query to find builds for a given package.
builds :: PackagesConfig -> Query BuildsFilter -> IO (StandardResults Build)
instance Eq BuildState
instance Show BuildState
instance Eq BuildsFilter
instance Show BuildsFilter
instance Eq CompletionTimeDisplay
instance Show CompletionTimeDisplay
instance Eq Build
instance Show Build
instance FromJSON Build
instance FromJSON CompletionTimeDisplay
instance ToJSON BuildsFilter


-- | Provides functions and datatypes for getting release information about
--   Fedora packages.
module Fedora.Packages.Releases
data Release
Release :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Release
_release :: Release -> Text
_stableVersion :: Release -> Text
_testingVersion :: Release -> Text

-- | Obtain release information about a package.
releases :: PackagesConfig -> Text -> IO (StandardResults Release)

-- | Helper method to query for release information without having to worry
--   about traversing into <a>StandardResults</a>.
--   
--   This is provided because this is one of the few places where the
--   paging information probably really doesn't matter.
--   
--   Equivalent to:
--   
--   <pre>
--   _srRows &lt;$&gt; releases c q
--   </pre>
releases' :: PackagesConfig -> Text -> IO [Release]
instance Eq Release
instance Show Release
instance Eq ReleasesFilter
instance Show ReleasesFilter
instance ToJSON ReleasesFilter
instance FromJSON Release


-- | Provides functions and datatypes for searching Fedora Packages.
module Fedora.Packages.Search
data Package
Package :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Maybe [Subpackage] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Package
_develOwner :: Package -> Text
_icon :: Package -> Text
_link :: Package -> Text
_name :: Package -> Text
_subPackages :: Package -> Maybe [Subpackage]
_summary :: Package -> Text
_upstreamUrl :: Package -> Text
_description :: Package -> Text
data Subpackage
Subpackage :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Subpackage
_subIcon :: Subpackage -> Text
_subLink :: Subpackage -> Text
_subName :: Subpackage -> Text
_subSummary :: Subpackage -> Text
_subDescription :: Subpackage -> Text
data SearchFilter
SearchFilter :: Text -> SearchFilter
_sfSearch :: SearchFilter -> Text

-- | Search Fedora Packages and return the package if an exact one is
--   found.
packageInfo :: PackagesConfig -> Text -> IO (Maybe Package)

-- | Search Fedora Packages for a given pattern.
search :: PackagesConfig -> Query SearchFilter -> IO (StandardResults Package)
instance Eq SearchFilter
instance Show SearchFilter
instance Eq Subpackage
instance Show Subpackage
instance Eq Package
instance Show Package
instance FromJSON Subpackage
instance FromJSON Package
instance ToJSON SearchFilter


-- | Provides lenses for data types found within Fedora.Packages.
module Fedora.Packages.Lens
bugStatus :: Lens' Bug Text
bugRelease :: Lens' Bug Text
bugLastModified :: Lens' Bug Text
bugId :: Lens' Bug Int
bugDescription :: Lens' Bug Text
bugClass :: Lens' Bug Text
bVersion :: Lens' BugsFilter Version
bPackage :: Lens' BugsFilter Text
volumeName :: Lens' Build Text
volumeId :: Lens' Build Int
version :: Lens' Build Text
taskId :: Lens' Build Int
stateStr :: Lens' Build Text
state :: Lens' Build Int
packageRelease :: Lens' Build Text
packageName :: Lens' Build Text
packageId :: Lens' Build Int
ownerName :: Lens' Build Text
ownerId :: Lens' Build Int
nvr :: Lens' Build Text
name' :: Lens' Build Text
epoch :: Lens' Build (Maybe Double)
creationTs :: Lens' Build Double
creationTime :: Lens' Build Text
creationEventId :: Lens' Build Int
completionTs :: Lens' Build Double
completionTimeDisplay :: Lens' Build CompletionTimeDisplay
completionTime :: Lens' Build Text
buildId :: Lens' Build Int
bfState :: Lens' BuildsFilter BuildState
bfPackage :: Lens' BuildsFilter Text
when :: Lens' CompletionTimeDisplay Text
time :: Lens' CompletionTimeDisplay Text
elapsed :: Lens' CompletionTimeDisplay Text
baseurl :: Iso' PackagesConfig URL
upstreamUrl :: Lens' Package Text
summary :: Lens' Package Text
subPackages :: Lens' Package (Maybe [Subpackage])
name :: Lens' Package Text
link :: Lens' Package Text
icon :: Lens' Package Text
develOwner :: Lens' Package Text
description :: Lens' Package Text
testingVersion :: Lens' Release Text
stableVersion :: Lens' Release Text
release :: Lens' Release Text
sfSearch :: Iso' SearchFilter Text
srVisibleRows :: Lens' (StandardResults a_a6Jd) Int
srTotalRows :: Lens' (StandardResults a_a6Jd) Int
srStartRow :: Lens' (StandardResults a_a6Jd) Int
srRowsPerPage :: Lens' (StandardResults a_a6Jd) Int
srRows :: Lens (StandardResults a_a6Jd) (StandardResults a_ang8) [a_a6Jd] [a_ang8]
qStartRow :: Lens' (Query a_a6Jc) Int
qSearch :: Lens (Query a_a6Jc) (Query a_anhq) a_a6Jc a_anhq
qRowsPerPage :: Lens' (Query a_a6Jc) Int


-- | Provides a Haskell interface to the <a>Fedora Packages</a> API.
--   
--   This module simply re-exports all public modules within the
--   fedora-packages project.
--   
--   Depending on usecase, it might be easiest to import this and Lens, as
--   below:
--   
--   <pre>
--   import Fedora.Packages
--   import Fedora.Packages.Lens
--   import Control.Lens
--   </pre>
--   
--   But keep in mind that this will clutter your namespace pretty badly,
--   and might not be ideal for all situations.
--   
--   If you don't want to use lenses (but you should because they are
--   awesome), you can do this instead:
--   
--   <pre>
--   import qualified Fedora.Packages as FedPackages
--   </pre>
--   
--   ...and then access everything using understored record-style getters,
--   e.g. <tt>_packageName theBuild</tt>.
--   
--   Or you can import specific pieces of
--   <tt>Fedora.Packages.&lt;whatever&gt;</tt> instead of importing
--   <tt>Fedora.Packages</tt> which re-exports everything.
--   
--   If you do that, however, you'll want to import
--   <tt>Fedora.Packages.API</tt> and <tt>Fedora.Packages.Config</tt> as
--   well, so that you have the necessary data types for interacting with
--   the API.
--   
--   TL;DR: This is written to be very modular, and you are free to use it
--   however it best fits in with the rest of your project. Have fun!
module Fedora.Packages
